definition: gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
to melt/to thaw/to blend/to merge/to be in harmony

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Bankers, financiers and fund managers are among the biggest losers.
sentences.chinese: 銀行家，金融家，和基金經理是最大的暑假。

sentences.english: I also spot Stone in a cameo I hadn't noticed before. He's plays a moneyman, a financier.
sentences.chinese: 我發現斯通也在裏邊露了臉，扮演一個有錢的金融家。

sentences.english: Part of it was done by those in power - politicians, financiers and technological utopians.
sentences.chinese: 一部分是由那些掌權的政治家，金融家和技術烏托邦。

sentences.english: In October 2011, another European moneyman headed for Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 2011年10月，又一位金融家來到北京。

sentences.english: My background is as a financier.
Executives at both firms praised Mr. Pang as a savvy financier.
sentences.chinese: 兩家公司的經營者都稱，彭日成是一位精明的金融家。

sentences.english: Some of the complaints of London's financiers are special pleading.
sentences.chinese: 一些來自倫敦金融家的抱怨是格外懇求的。

definition: George Soros or György Schwartz (1930-), Hungarian American financial speculator and millionaire philanthropist
lit. big crocodile/fig. major figure/big shot/top boss (esp. criminal)
